('81', 405, 0, 1, 679968) 406 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 405, 1, 2, 680010) 677. SPEECH AT GUJARAT PROVINCIAL CONGRESS COMMITTEE MEETING 1
('81', 405, 2, 3, 680073) BARDOLI, January 4, 1942
('81', 405, 3, 4, 680098) [Gandhiji] first asked everyone if he had understood all the implications of the
('81', 405, 4, 5, 680179) Bardoli Resolution.
('81', 405, 5, 6, 680199) Then let me put it to you in a nutshell.
('81', 405, 5, 7, 680240) The resolution means that, if the Government gave a guarantee that full freedom would be given after the war, the Congress would help in keeping this Empire alive.
('81', 405, 5, 8, 680404) It was not that the bargain had been actually made, but the terms had been agreed upon, whereas, if I did not want to enter into any bargain at all, I should plainly say so.
('81', 405, 5, 9, 680578) If you feel that on your agreeing to offer full co operation in the war effort, India will have complete independence after the war, that the British will thereafter remain in India at your mercy and sufferance, that even during the war you will run your own affairs provided of course that your Defence Minister will carry on the war to victory, you must confirm the Bardoli Resolution.
('81', 405, 5, 10, 680966) The temptation is very great indeed.
('81', 405, 5, 11, 681003) If for that sake you are ready to reverse the Congress policy and purchase swaraj and pay as price thereof ahimsa, you must confirm the resolution.
('81', 405, 5, 12, 681151) Remember that the very greatest of our leaders are party to the resolution and they have not chosen to do so lightly.
('81', 405, 5, 13, 681269) As against this there are those who think that ahimsa is a pearl of great price and that it cannot be given up, that it can never be the price of swaraj, then their position is different.
('81', 405, 5, 14, 681457) But if you are in doubt, if you feel that in sticking to ahimsa you lose both ahimsa, because you are incapable of it, and swaraj, that Gandhi is a good man but it would be prudent not to go the whole length with him, then you must accept the resolution.
('81', 405, 5, 15, 681712) Only those will express their disapproval of it who are sure in their heart of hearts that prudence, political insight, policy, every conside ration demands that ahimsa may not be sacrificed for swaraj.
('81', 405, 5, 16, 681915) Now let those who will vote for the Bardoli Resolution raise their hands.
('81', 405, 6, 17, 681989) 1 Reproduced from Mahadev Desai’s “The Month in Bardoli–I” 2 In reply several people did not raise their hands.
('81', 405, 6, 18, 682101) For the Resolution, vide Appendix “Congress Woring Committee Resolution”, 30 12 1941. 3 Thirty six raised their hands.
('81', 406, 0, 1, 682220) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARTY, 1942 407
('81', 406, 1, 2, 682268) Now let the acharyas (masters) of ahimsa raise their hands.
('81', 406, 2, 3, 682328) There were about ten neutrals who wanted to put questions, but Gandhiji said as the vote was quite informal the neutrals need not trouble themselves.
('81', 406, 3, 4, 682478) Mahatma Gandhi stated that he had not left the Congress, and his position was the same even at Bombay.
('81', 406, 3, 5, 682581) He said : I am a servant of the Congress and I want to serve the Congress in consonance with the principles of truth and non violence.
('81', 406, 3, 6, 682716) The Working Committee has decided to co operate with the Government in war if Britain grants swaraj to India.
('81', 406, 3, 7, 682826) Whatever be my opinion, you must exercise our free judgement in this matter.
('81', 406, 3, 8, 682903) It is not a fact that the Congress has violated the principle of non violence but it has only made a small opening for violence just with a view to shaking hands with Britain.
('81', 406, 3, 9, 683079) Rajaji thinks that all of us should go to war fully armed, but it may not be the opinion of all.

('81', 408, 4, 8, 685468) 682. STATEMENT TO THE PRESS 1
('81', 408, 5, 9, 685498) BARDOLI, January 7, 1942 As far as may be, I have been endeavouring to study the internal and external reaction to the Working Committee resolution.
('81', 408, 5, 10, 685647) 2 My being relieved of the direction of Congress civil disobedience does not reduce my responsibility but increases it manifold.
('81', 408, 5, 11, 685776) For one thing, my official disconnection with the Congress itself increases my detach ment; but since detachment never means indifference, my attachment to every Congressman increases and I must speak to him more than before.
('81', 408, 5, 12, 686002) The voice of silence was enough to direct the campaign of civil disobedience, but it is not enough to explain and interpret in terms of non violence the day to day puzzles that arise in the minds of Congressmen and others by reason of the overwhelming events happening near us.
('81', 408, 5, 13, 686280) Rangoon was naturally and culturally part of us before Burma years ago became part of British India and, therefore, it remains part of us though now sundered.
('81', 408, 5, 14, 686439) What has happened there, 3 has had its repercussions all over India.
('81', 408, 5, 15, 686508) So far as I can see, civil disobedience in the sense in which it was launched is not likely to be revived on behalf of the Congress till the war has ended.
('81', 408, 5, 16, 686664) In a purely symbolic manner it may have to be kept up not in the name of the Congress but on behalf of resisters of all war on the pure ground of non violence, no matter how few they are.
('81', 408, 5, 17, 686852) It will be kept up for the sake of asserting the right of resisters to carry on propaganda against all war.
('81', 408, 5, 18, 686960) They dare not keep still in the midst of
('81', 408, 6, 19, 687001) 1 This appeared in Harijan under the title “The Next Phase”.
('81', 408, 6, 20, 687062) 2 This sentence is from The Bombay Chronicle.
('81', 408, 6, 21, 687108) For the Working Committee resolution, vide Appendix “Congress Woring Committee Resolution”, 30 12 1941.
('81', 408, 7, 22, 687212) 3 Rangoon was bombed by the Japanese on December 23, 1941.

('81', 409, 1, 2, 687313) the unhuman slaughter that is going on.
('81', 409, 1, 3, 687353) They must not only speak and write against it, they must, if need be, sacrifice themselves in the attempt to stop the torrent of blood.
('81', 409, 1, 4, 687489) Whether they are a few or many they have to live their mission.
('81', 409, 1, 5, 687553) Before taking any step in the direction of civil disobedience I propose to restart the three weeklies 1 and understand the reaction of Government to the new orientation.

('81', 419, 1, 17, 711622) This does not require brave resolutions.

('81', 419, 1, 19, 711711) As far as I know at the present moment this is common ground between the rulers and the people.
('81', 419, 1, 20, 711807) Let every Congressman answer for himself whether he will be a soldier or servant of peace or whether he will become a non entity unwilling to take his place in building up swaraj.
('81', 419, 1, 21, 711987) ON TRAIN BARDOLI WARDHA, January 9, 1942 Harijan, 18 1 1942
('81', 419, 2, 22, 712047) 692. WHY?
('81', 419, 3, 23, 712057) While I was engaged in organizing and conducting the civil disobedience movement on behalf of the Congress I could not issue the three weeklies without noticing the doings of civil resisters and the general progress of the movement.
('81', 419, 3, 24, 712290) That would have been to turn the weeklies into civil disobedience organs and to challenge the Govern ment to suppress them.
('81', 419, 3, 25, 712414) The Government in their turn could not but have accepted the challenge and suppressed the papers and even prosecuted me.
('81', 419, 3, 26, 712535) Whilst I must always be ready to welcome imprison ment, I was not then ready to court it.
('81', 419, 3, 27, 712625) Nor was it my plan to invite suppression when my avowed object was to organize strictly and only individual civil disobedience.
('81', 419, 3, 28, 712753) Therefore, even at the price of sacrifi cing the pleasure of serving the people in various ways through the
('81', 420, 0, 1, 712861) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARTY, 1942 421
('81', 420, 1, 2, 712909) weeklies, duty demanded their stoppage.
('81', 420, 1, 3, 712949) I feel that the step taken was correct in every way.
('81', 420, 1, 4, 713002) The reason for suspension now no longer exists.
('81', 420, 1, 5, 713050) On the contrary I should fail in my duty, if I did not resume publication.
('81', 420, 1, 6, 713125) As I have repeatedly said I am no enemy of Britain.
('81', 420, 1, 7, 713177) I have many dear and personal friends among Britishers.
('81', 420, 1, 8, 713233) I cannot wish ill to Britain.
('81', 420, 1, 9, 713263) My resistance to war does not carry me to the point of thwarting those who wish to take part in it.
('81', 420, 1, 10, 713363) I reason with them.
('81', 420, 1, 11, 713383) I put before them the better way and leave them to make the choice.
('81', 420, 1, 12, 713451) But we have arrived at a stage where it is no longer merely a question of resisting war effort.
('81', 420, 1, 13, 713547) There are questions which confront war resisters as much as they confront war mongers.
('81', 420, 1, 14, 713634) And they can be decided only one way by both, though the approach must vary.
('81', 420, 1, 15, 713711) Such are questions of dealing with scarcity of food and clothing, looting and bread riots, etc.
('81', 420, 1, 16, 713807) I have views on all these and like questions.
('81', 420, 1, 17, 713853) Resumption of the weeklies is needed for the dissemination of my views on these and like matters.
('81', 420, 1, 18, 713951) In the ability of the people to deal with them without fuss and even without Government effort lies the way to swaraj whose basis is non violence.
('81', 420, 1, 19, 714098) Mere Government effort cannot deal with crises affecting millions of people unless there is voluntary response from them.
('81', 420, 1, 20, 714220) If we wish to achieve swaraj through truth and non violence, gradual but steady building up from the bottom upwards by construc tive effort is the only way.
('81', 420, 1, 21, 714377) This rules out the deliberate creation of an anarchical state for the overthrow of the established order in the hope of throwing up from within a dictator who would rule with a rod of iron and produce order out of disorder.
('81', 420, 1, 22, 714601) These columns will then deal with the day to day problems that face the people.
('81', 420, 1, 23, 714681) ON TRAIN BARDOLI WARDHA, January 9, 1942 Harijan, 18 1 1942

('81', 423, 4, 11, 718102) 698. HAND SPUN AS MEASURE OF VALUE 1
('81', 423, 5, 12, 718139) In my part of India shells and seedless dried almonds were used as coins accepted by the people and the State treasury.
('81', 423, 5, 13, 718259) They had no intrinsic value.
('81', 423, 5, 14, 718288) They were a measure of people’s deep poverty.
('81', 423, 5, 15, 718334) They could not afford the lowest metal coin.
('81', 423, 5, 16, 718379) Five shells would buy them a little vegetable or a needle.
('81', 423, 5, 17, 718438) I have suggested a measure which will not be a mere token but which will have always an intrinsic value which will also be its market value.
('81', 423, 5, 18, 718579) In that sense it will be an ideal measure.
('81', 423, 5, 19, 718622) For the present and by way of experiment I have suggested a warp length of a single thread of yarn as the lowest measure and to be used in dealings principally with the spinners and generally with khadi lovers.
('81', 423, 5, 20, 718833) The spinners can have all their daily wants supplied as against a fixed quantity of yarn.
('81', 423, 5, 21, 718923) Stores will need to be maintained by the A. I. S. A. in combination with the A. I. V. I. A. and ultimately with those who will give their co operation.
('81', 423, 5, 22, 719075) As I conceive it, the system can be worked only if it is decentralized.
('81', 423, 5, 23, 719147) This is not its demerit but merit.
('81', 423, 5, 24, 719182) The end to be sought is human happiness combined with full mental and moral development.
('81', 423, 5, 25, 719271) I use the adjective moral as synonymous with spiritual.
('81', 423, 5, 26, 719327) This end can be achieved under decentralization.
('81', 423, 5, 27, 719376) Centrali zation as a system is inconsistent with non violent structure of society.
('81', 423, 5, 28, 719459) I have presented to khadi workers and those who are interested in the solution of the problem of India’s poverty, the idea of a measure of value in its barest outline.
('81', 423, 5, 29, 719627) Let them work it out and find for them selves flaws, if any, in the conception, and if they do not, let them enforce it where they can.
('81', 423, 5, 30, 719763) SEVAGRAM, January 13, 1942 Harijan, 18 1 1942

('81', 427, 0, 1, 724917) 428 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 427, 1, 2, 724959) 705. SPEECH AT A. I. C. C. MEETING 1
('81', 427, 2, 3, 724996) WARDHA, January 15, 1942 The President has put me in a quandary by raising me skyhigh, as if, one may think, I were a dweller in the clouds.
('81', 427, 2, 4, 725137) That is not at all true.
('81', 427, 2, 5, 725162) I have not yet used an aeroplane—of course, I have seen them flying in the skies, like birds but I have not touched one.
('81', 427, 2, 6, 725283) So the question of flying does not arise.
('81', 427, 2, 7, 725325) It is misuse of language to call such a man a dweller in the skies.
('81', 427, 2, 8, 725393) I am of the earth, earthy.
('81', 427, 2, 9, 725420) I am an ordi nary mortal composed of common clay.
('81', 427, 2, 10, 725470) The question of ahimsa would not have come up before you, had it not come up before the Working Committee at Bardoli.
('81', 427, 2, 11, 725588) We discussed it for seven days.
('81', 427, 2, 12, 725620) And it was well that it came up.
('81', 427, 2, 13, 725653) The result has been good, not bad.
('81', 427, 2, 14, 725688) But before I say anything on this question, let me make one or two things clear.
('81', 427, 2, 15, 725769) Please note that I am, as I have said, an ordinary mortal like you.
('81', 427, 2, 16, 725837) Had this not been the case, we should not have been able to work together these twenty years.
('81', 427, 2, 17, 725931) Ahimsa with me is a creed, the breath of life.
('81', 427, 2, 18, 725978) But it is never as a creed that I placed it before India or, for that matter, before anyone except in casual or informal talks.
('81', 427, 2, 19, 726106) I placed it before the Congress as a political weapon, to be employed for the solution of political problems.
('81', 427, 2, 20, 726216) It is a new experiment in ahimsa which I have undertaken.
('81', 427, 2, 21, 726274) As far as I am aware, no one has hitherto em ployed ahimsa in the political arena in this manner.
('81', 427, 2, 22, 726372) If someone has, at least I am not aware of it.
('81', 427, 2, 23, 726419) Maybe it is a novel method, but it does not on that account lose its political character.
('81', 427, 2, 24, 726509) I tried this for the first time in South Africa, with good results.
('81', 427, 2, 25, 726577) I have brought it from there.
('81', 427, 2, 26, 726607) The question there was exclusively of the political existence of Indians who had no political consciousness but had settled in South Africa as merchants, petty hawkers, etc.
('81', 427, 2, 27, 726781) And there I used ahimsa as a political weapon.
('81', 427, 2, 28, 726828) It was for them a question of life and death.
('81', 427, 2, 29, 726874) The whites wanted them to quit.
('81', 427, 2, 30, 726906) They had only two alternatives.
('81', 427, 2, 31, 726938) They could either quit or stay there with the status of animals.
('81', 427, 2, 32, 727003) We tried everything that was humanly possible.
('81', 427, 2, 33, 727050) We found that all the so called constitutional remedies, with which the Congress work in India had made me familiar, had failed.
('81', 427, 2, 34, 727179) I was an expert in petition writing which had yielded me lots of money.
('81', 427, 2, 35, 727251) I have been for long a draftsman for
('81', 427, 3, 36, 727288) 1 This translation has been collated with the summary by Mahadev Desai published in Harijan, 25 1 1942, under the title “Don’t Divide the House”.
('81', 428, 0, 1, 727434) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARTY, 1942 429
('81', 428, 1, 2, 727482) the Congress here, which work I used to do there also.
('81', 428, 1, 3, 727537) They submitted many petitions, but when all other methods failed they resorted to satyagraha.
('81', 428, 1, 4, 727631) The various measures that I adopted there were not the work of a visionary or a dreamer.
('81', 428, 1, 5, 727720) They were the work of an essen tially practical man dealing with practical political questions.
('81', 428, 1, 6, 727816) As a political method, it can always be changed, modified, altered, even given up in preference to another.
('81', 428, 1, 7, 727924) If, therefore, I say to you that our policy should not be given up today, I am talking political wisdom.
('81', 428, 1, 8, 728029) It is political insight.
('81', 428, 1, 9, 728054) It has served us in the past, it has enabled us to traverse many stages towards independence, and it is a politician that I tell you that it would be a grave mistake to think of giving it up.
('81', 428, 1, 10, 728246) If I have carried the Congress with me all these years, it is in my capacity as a politician.
('81', 428, 1, 11, 728340) It is hardly fair to describe my method as religious because it is new.
('81', 428, 1, 12, 728412) Maulana Saheb has affectionately used high words of praise for me, but I cannot accept them.
('81', 428, 1, 13, 728505) A thing can yet be discarded after showering all praise on it.
('81', 428, 1, 14, 728568) A person can be raised sky high and then cast down to the dust.
('81', 428, 1, 15, 728632) I have been taunted as a Bania.

('81', 435, 1, 25, 748378) But the power of non co operation comes only through solid, incessant constructive work.
('81', 435, 1, 26, 748467) Non violent strength comes from the constructive programme only and not through destructive activi ties.
('81', 435, 1, 27, 748572) Hence the constructive programme is the only thing before the Congress today.
('81', 435, 1, 28, 748650) And in this all parties are at one.
('81', 435, 1, 29, 748686) There are instructions about the constructive programme for Congressmen.
('81', 435, 1, 30, 748759) They form the operative part.
('81', 435, 1, 31, 748789) If properly implemented, this would be a complete substitute for civil disobedience and the parliamentary programme.
('81', 435, 1, 32, 748906) Civil disobedience has been wisely reserved for me as an expert in satyagraha.
('81', 435, 1, 33, 748985) It is good, so long as I am alive and well in mind, that it is so reserved.
('81', 435, 1, 34, 749061) I have almost put a stop to it today.
('81', 435, 1, 35, 749099) But the suspension of satyagraha is not linked with the resolution.
('81', 435, 1, 36, 749167) So far as I am concerned, there will be no need for
('81', 436, 0, 1, 749219) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARTY, 1942 437
('81', 436, 1, 2, 749267) satyagraha, if the Government do not interfere with Harijan.
('81', 436, 1, 3, 749328) For these three weeklies will constitute enough propaganda against all war.
('81', 436, 1, 4, 749404) Harijan will try to carry the message of peace to all corners of the country.
('81', 436, 1, 5, 749482) But if this is not permitted, then will be the time for civil disobedience as a gesture.
('81', 436, 1, 6, 749571) I want every worker to be out for constructive activity.
('81', 436, 1, 7, 749628) Today we have to serve the millions and that work does not allow us to get shut up in prisons.
('81', 436, 1, 8, 749723) We do not wish that thieves and robbers may ransack the country.
('81', 436, 1, 9, 749788) Even if we want to unleash a revolution, we shall have to provide for the prevention of pillage.
('81', 436, 1, 10, 749885) The Congress will disappear if it fails to do this.
('81', 436, 1, 11, 749937) The work of providing adequate food and clothing to the famished devolves on our shoulders.
('81', 436, 1, 12, 750029) But if even the pen is snatched away from my hands, I may be compelled to become the sole resister.
('81', 436, 1, 13, 750129) But I have no fixed plans.
('81', 436, 1, 14, 750156) Events will point the way.
('81', 436, 2, 15, 750183) The suspension of satyagraha has connection only with the present condition of the country, and I want every single man who thinks with me to remain outside and do work rather than go to jail and read the Koran and the Gita and lead an easy life there.
('81', 436, 2, 16, 750436) I won’t let them lead an easy life.
('81', 436, 2, 17, 750472) Jawaharlal will ask for diaries from thousands of men.
('81', 436, 2, 18, 750527) He is not going to sleep.
('81', 436, 2, 19, 750553) Therefore, if you will go away with the real message to the country, do not criticize this resolution.
('81', 436, 2, 20, 750656) Nobody is rendered incapable of giving the fullest possible service, in fact he is made capable of the fullest growth, by reason of this resolution.
('81', 436, 2, 21, 750805) Civil disobedience remains under my control, and the reason for its suspension is wholly extraneous to my retirement from office.
('81', 436, 2, 22, 750935) Every one of you has to give a good account of yourself.
('81', 436, 2, 23, 750992) If all will pull your full weight in the fulfilment of the constructive programme, you will find a different India in six months’ time.

('81', 438, 1, 2, 752686) 709. ADDRESS TO CONGRESS WORKERS 1
('81', 438, 2, 3, 752721) WARDHAGANJ, January 17, 1942
('81', 438, 3, 4, 752750) Gandhiji explained what had been achieved at Sevagram in regard to the
('81', 438, 4, 5, 752821) restoration of communal unity and removal of untouchability and urged that they were
('81', 438, 5, 6, 752906) assets which should be acquired whether freedom was obtained or not.
('81', 438, 5, 7, 752975) He also pointed
('81', 438, 6, 8, 752991) out what work had been done with regard to khadi and basic education.
('81', 438, 7, 9, 753061) He dealt with the various aspects of the constructive programme, with
('81', 438, 8, 10, 753131) particular reference to Hindu Muslim unity, the removal of untouchability, charkha
('81', 438, 9, 11, 753214) and the organization of a volunteer corps.
('81', 438, 10, 12, 753257) Mahatma Gandhi emphasized that a mere pact between the Congress and the
('81', 438, 11, 13, 753329) Muslim League would not solve the problem; such a pact was applicable only to the
('81', 438, 12, 14, 753411) carrying out of the parliamentary programme.
('81', 438, 12, 15, 753456) He referred to the Lucknow Congress 
('81', 438, 13, 16, 753493) League Pact 2 and said that real Hindu Muslim unity could only be brought about by
('81', 438, 14, 17, 753576) active constructive work.
('81', 438, 15, 18, 753602) Answering a question, Gandhiji said that volunteer bodies must be organized
('81', 438, 16, 19, 753678) but only on the basis of non violence.
('81', 438, 16, 20, 753717) The volunteers must render all help to the
('81', 438, 17, 21, 753760) people.
('81', 438, 17, 22, 753768) It was possible that these organizations might not be allowed to function.
('81', 438, 18, 23, 753843) such circumstances, they must carry on their work, if it was indispensable, even at the
('81', 438, 19, 24, 753931) risk of their lives.
('81', 438, 20, 25, 753952) Everyone who is a four anna member of the Congress must become a Khudai Khidmatgar now by service to the people.
('81', 438, 21, 26, 754065) Concluding, Gandhiji exhorted them to carry out the instructions given by the
('81', 438, 22, 27, 754143) Working Committee carefully, which alone would strengthen them in the struggle for
('81', 438, 23, 28, 754226) freedom.
('81', 438, 23, 29, 754235) The Hindu, 18 1 1942

('81', 439, 1, 2, 754604) 710. TALK WITH A WORKER 1
('81', 439, 2, 3, 754630) [Before January 18, 1942]
('81', 439, 3, 4, 754656) The would be satyagrahi 2 said he was a believer in ahimsa.
('81', 439, 3, 5, 754716) Gandhiji asked him : How much do you spin—5 yards or 50 yards?
('81', 439, 4, 6, 754779) Never more than 50, and sometimes even less than 5. Do you spin every day, or once every week, or every month?
('81', 439, 5, 7, 754890) I don’t spin more than 50 or 100 yards in a month.
('81', 439, 5, 8, 754941) Do you make your own slivers?
('81', 439, 6, 9, 754971) No, Mahatmaji.
('81', 439, 6, 10, 754986) Then where do you get them from?
('81', 439, 6, 11, 755019) Get them by post?
('81', 439, 7, 12, 755037) No, I get them from the khadi bhandar, and when I do not get them there, I get them through friends coming from places where slivers can be had.
('81', 439, 7, 13, 755182) Do you make you mal (string) yourself or do you purchase a reel from the market?
('81', 439, 8, 14, 755263) His friend intervened and said : “Mahatmaji, he is a believer in ahimsa, and that, I thought, was the essential qualification.
('81', 439, 8, 15, 755390) According to the test you now apply we are all likely to fail.” Well, then it is better that none of you takes part in satyagraha than that you should go without being properly qualified.
('81', 439, 8, 16, 755578) My standard is inexorable.
('81', 439, 8, 17, 755605) I want you to spin not only regularly but intelligently.
('81', 439, 8, 18, 755662) I want you to know how to test your yarn, how to draw fine yarn and coarse yarn, to know the economics of khadi and so on.
('81', 439, 8, 19, 755785) And when you will say to me, ‘I know all these things’, I will ask you : ‘What about you life?’ Do you observe non violence in your relations with the members of your family and in your daily affairs?
('81', 439, 8, 20, 755986) Where is the good of your saying you accept non violence in theory?
('81', 439, 8, 21, 756054) Supposing you said you accepted the theory of khadi, but purchased and used foreign cloth, how would your acceptance of the theory help me?
('81', 439, 8, 22, 756194) And please understand that, while in British India I am prepared to reconcile myself to belief in ahimsa as a policy, I want you in the States to believe in it as a creed.
('81', 439, 8, 23, 756366) Violence in many Indian States is greater than in British India, and we want the supreme purity and sacrifice of a Prahlada to meet the violence there.
('81', 439, 8, 24, 756518) Give me a Prahlada, and I shall give him my blessings.
('81', 439, 8, 25, 756573) Harijan, 18 1 1942

('81', 440, 3, 13, 757452) If they are otherwise and you have no such fear as they entertain, your opinion should prevail.

('81', 441, 0, 1, 758288) 442 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 441, 1, 2, 758330) 713. REAL WAR EFFORT The greatest need of the immediate present is to feed the hungry and clothe the naked.
('81', 441, 1, 3, 758438) There is already scarcity in the land both of food and clothing.
('81', 441, 1, 4, 758503) As the war progresses, both the scarcities must increase.
('81', 441, 1, 5, 758561) There are no imports from outside, either of food stuff or of cloth.
('81', 441, 1, 6, 758630) The well to do may not feel the pinch as yet or at all, but the poor are feeling it now.
('81', 441, 1, 7, 758719) The well to do live on the poor.
('81', 441, 1, 8, 758752) There is no other way.
('81', 441, 1, 9, 758775) What is then their duty?
('81', 441, 1, 10, 758800) He who saves gains as much, that is to say, he produces as much.
('81', 441, 1, 11, 758865) Hence those who feel for the poor, those who would be one with them must curtail their wants.
('81', 441, 1, 12, 758959) There are many ways.
('81', 441, 1, 13, 758980) I shall only mention some here.
('81', 441, 1, 14, 759012) There is much, too much food eaten and wasted by the well to do.
('81', 441, 1, 15, 759077) Use one grain at a time.
('81', 441, 1, 16, 759102) Chapati, rice, and pulses, milk, gur, ghee, and oil are used in ordinary households besides vegetables and fruit.
('81', 441, 1, 17, 759216) I regard this as an unhealthy combination.
('81', 441, 1, 18, 759259) Those who get animal protein in the shape of milk, cheese, eggs or meat need not use pulses at all.
('81', 441, 1, 19, 759359) The poor people get only vegetable protein.
('81', 441, 1, 20, 759403) If the well to do give up pulses and oils, they set free these two essentials for the poor who get neither animal protein nor animal fat.
('81', 441, 1, 21, 759541) Then the grain eaten should not be sloppy.
('81', 441, 1, 22, 759584) Half the quantity suffices when it is eaten dry and not dipped in any gravy.
('81', 441, 1, 23, 759661) It is well to eat it with raw salads such as onion, carrot, radish, salad leaves, tomatoes.
('81', 441, 1, 24, 759753) An ounce or two of salads serves the purpose of eight ounces of cooked vegetables.
('81', 441, 1, 25, 759836) Chapatis or bread should not be eaten with milk.
('81', 441, 1, 26, 759885) To begin with, one meal may be raw vegetables and chapati or bread, and the other cooked vegetables with milk or curds.
('81', 441, 1, 27, 760005) Sweet dishes should be eliminated altogether.
('81', 441, 1, 28, 760051) Instead, gur or sugar in small quantities may be taken with milk or bread or by itself.
('81', 441, 1, 29, 760139) Fresh fruit is good to eat, but only a little is necessary to give tone to the system.
('81', 441, 1, 30, 760226) It is an expensive article, and an over indulgence by the well to do has deprived the poor and the ailing of an article which they need much more than the well to do.
('81', 441, 1, 31, 760393) Any medical man who has studied the science of dietetics will certify that what I have suggested can do no harm to the body, on the contrary it must conduce to better health.
('81', 441, 1, 32, 760568) This is only one way of saving food stuff.
('81', 441, 1, 33, 760611) It is obvious.
('81', 441, 1, 34, 760626) But by itself it cannot produce much visible effect.
('81', 441, 1, 35, 760679) Grain dealers have to shed their greed and the habit of making as much profit as possible.
('81', 441, 1, 36, 760770) They must be satisfied with as little as possible.
('81', 441, 1, 37, 760821) They run the risk of being looted, if they do not gain the credit of being keepers of grain for the sake of the poor.
('81', 441, 1, 38, 760939) They should
('81', 442, 0, 1, 760951) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARY, 1942 443
('81', 442, 1, 2, 760998) be in touch with the people in their neighbourhood.
('81', 442, 1, 3, 761050) Congressmen have to visit grain dealers within their beat and give them the message of the time.
('81', 442, 1, 4, 761147) By far the most important part of the work consists in educating the villagers to keep what they have and to induce cultivation of fresh crops wherever water is available.
('81', 442, 1, 5, 761319) This requires widespread and intelligent propaganda.
('81', 442, 1, 6, 761372) It is not generally known that bananas, potatoes, beetroot, yam and suran, and in a measure pumpkin are a food crop easily grown.
('81', 442, 1, 7, 761502) They can take the place of bread in time of need.
('81', 442, 1, 8, 761552) There is, too, scarcity of money.
('81', 442, 1, 9, 761586) There may be grain available but no money to buy it with.
('81', 442, 1, 10, 761644) There is no money because there is no employment.
('81', 442, 1, 11, 761694) This has to be found.
('81', 442, 1, 12, 761716) Spinning is the readiest and the handiest.
('81', 442, 1, 13, 761759) But local needs may supply other sources of labour.
('81', 442, 1, 14, 761811) Every available source has to be tapped so that there is no want of employment.
('81', 442, 1, 15, 761891) Only the lazy ones need and must starve.
('81', 442, 1, 16, 761932) Patient handling will induce even this class to shed their laziness.
('81', 442, 1, 17, 762001) The problem of clothing is much easier than feeding, if it is handled well and in time.
('81', 442, 1, 18, 762089) The mills may not be relied on in these times.
('81', 442, 1, 19, 762136) There is ample cotton to be had in India.
('81', 442, 1, 20, 762178) It is a problem for cotton cultivators how to dispose of their stock.
('81', 442, 1, 21, 762248) The outside market is closed to them.
('81', 442, 1, 22, 762286) Our mills cannot absorb the whole of the crop.
('81', 442, 1, 23, 762333) It can be utilized, if the nation takes to spinning not for wages but for the sake of clothing the naked.
('81', 442, 1, 24, 762439) Of course those who need employment will spin for profit.
('81', 442, 1, 25, 762497) This number must be limited.
('81', 442, 1, 26, 762526) They need organizing.
('81', 442, 1, 27, 762548) Much money will be needed for the purpose.
('81', 442, 1, 28, 762591) But national spinning does not need so much organizing.
('81', 442, 1, 29, 762647) Profit motive being eliminated and willingness being assumed, organization is reduced to simplest terms.
('81', 442, 1, 30, 762752) This is no time for multiplying wheels.
('81', 442, 1, 31, 762792) They take time to manufacture.
('81', 442, 1, 32, 762823) Raw materials are daily becoming dearer.
('81', 442, 1, 33, 762864) Wheels cannot be manufactured everywhere.
('81', 442, 1, 34, 762906) Places where they are can be counted on the fingers of one hand.
('81', 442, 1, 35, 762971) Therefore I suggest the plying of the dhanush takli and even the simple takli.
('81', 442, 1, 36, 763050) The former should be manufactured locally.
('81', 442, 1, 37, 763093) Indeed it is difficult to manufacture the simple takli at once in lacs.
('81', 442, 1, 38, 763165) The dhanush takli is the only thing which can be easiest manufactured.
('81', 442, 1, 39, 763236) Slivers cannot be supplied to spinners.
('81', 442, 1, 40, 763276) Each one should get some cotton for himself or herself, and card it as well as may be with the hand or with a home made small bow such as the children in the Bihar basic schools have.
('81', 442, 1, 41, 763460) All this can be done because no one is expected to manufacture a large quantity of yarn.
('81', 442, 1, 42, 763549) If every one of our available
('81', 443, 0, 1, 763579) 444 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 443, 1, 2, 763621) millions span for one hour daily, there would be enough yarn to keep every handloom going.
('81', 443, 1, 3, 763712) The reader should know that there are lacs of handloom weavers in the land.
('81', 443, 1, 4, 763788) There is danger of their starving for want of yarn.
('81', 443, 1, 5, 763840) Here is a great task for every Congressman to undertake.
('81', 443, 1, 6, 763897) He has to become a good spinner and carder and know how to manufacture the dhanush takli.
('81', 443, 1, 7, 763987) Let every Congressman begin with himself and his family and neighbours, and he will find that the life giving contagion spreads like wild fire which envelops you before you hardly know what you are witnessing.
('81', 443, 1, 8, 764197) Any organization that tackles these two problems successfully will command the love and confidence of the people.
('81', 443, 1, 9, 764311) I hope that all will join in this real war effort.
('81', 443, 1, 10, 764362) It is none the less effective because it is peaceful and constructive.
('81', 443, 1, 11, 764433) Will the Princes let their people do this work without let or hindrance?
('81', 443, 1, 12, 764506) Will Quaid e Azam Jinnah allow the members of the Muslim League to co operate with the Congress workers in this truly national but non political work which is also humanitarian?
('81', 443, 1, 13, 764684) There are 23,000 Muslim spinners, carders and weavers earning their daily bread through the A.I.S.A. ON THE WAY TO KASHI, January 19, 1942 Harijan, 25 1 1942
('81', 443, 2, 14, 764842) 714. CONSTRUCTIVE PROGRAMME AND GOVERNMENT Will not the working of the constructive programme bring Congressmen into conflict with the Government?
('81', 443, 2, 15, 764989) This was one of the many questions asked at the meeting of the principal members of the A. I. C. C. I addressed in Wardha on the 17th.
('81', 443, 2, 16, 765124) My answer was that the whole programme was so conceived as to avoid conflict.
('81', 443, 2, 17, 765202) Of course the most innocent activity may be so manipulated as to provoke conflict.
('81', 443, 2, 18, 765285) I expect every Congress worker to do his best to avoid it.
('81', 443, 2, 19, 765344) But there is no help for it, if the Government prohibit such activities because they are undertaken by Congressmen who believe that the working of the constructive programme will bring swaraj.
('81', 443, 2, 20, 765537) That is the only non violent way to achieve the end.
('81', 443, 2, 21, 765590) Swaraj by non violent means must come from the creative effort of those who desire it.
('81', 443, 2, 22, 765677) The Government should welcome every such effort, unless they want to prevent even cent per cent non violent movement.
('81', 443, 2, 23, 765795) In that case conflict will become unavoidable.
('81', 443, 2, 24, 765842) But I am of opinion that no conflict is possible, at any rate while the war lasts, unless the Congress workers want or provoke it.
('81', 443, 2, 25, 765973) They have to work, work and work.
('81', 443, 2, 26, 766007) They will make no speeches or
('81', 444, 0, 1, 766037) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARY, 1942 445
('81', 444, 1, 2, 766084) demonstrations in doing their constructive work.
('81', 444, 1, 3, 766133) As I have already said, today most of the items of constructive work happen to be—like feeding and clothing—common cause between the Government and the people.
('81', 444, 1, 4, 766293) ON THE WAY TO KASHI, January 19, 1942 Harijan, 25 1 1942 715. COMMUNAL UNITY Freedom will not come through parliamentary effort.
('81', 444, 1, 5, 766422) Therefore communal pacts, whilst they are good if they can be had, are valueless unless they are backed by the union of hearts.
('81', 444, 1, 6, 766550) Without it there can be no peace in the land.
('81', 444, 1, 7, 766596) Even Pakistan can bring no peace, if there is no union of hearts.
('81', 444, 1, 8, 766662) This union can come only by mutual service and co operative work.
('81', 444, 1, 9, 766728) Separate electorates have resulted in the separation of hearts.
('81', 444, 1, 10, 766792) They presupposed mutual distrust and conflict of interests.
('81', 444, 1, 11, 766852) They have tended to perpetuate differences and deepen the distrust.
('81', 444, 1, 12, 766920) How to get out of the tangle is the question.
('81', 444, 1, 13, 766966) I want just now to confine myself to the four Muslim majority provinces.
('81', 444, 1, 14, 767039) In them there is natural Pakistan in the sense that the permanent majority can rule the minority.
('81', 444, 1, 15, 767137) I hold it to be utterly wrong thus to divide man from man by reason of religion which is liable to change.
('81', 444, 1, 16, 767244) What conflict of interest can there be between Hindus and Muslims in the matter of revenue, sanitation, police, justice, or the use of public conveniences?
('81', 444, 1, 17, 767400) The difference can only be in religious usage and observances with which a secular State has no concern.
('81', 444, 1, 18, 767505) Congressmen, if they are not to merge in the Hindus as Hindus, must rigidly abstain from the legislatures and local bodies governed by separate electorates.
('81', 444, 1, 19, 767662) In these provinces the separate electorates must be taken to have come from the Hindu demand and in the supposed Hindu interest.
('81', 444, 1, 20, 767791) But a Congress Hindu has no interest apart from his Muslim brother.
('81', 444, 1, 21, 767859) Therefore he must not enter the electoral bodies where Hindu and Muslim interests are falsely regarded as separate and even antagonistic.
('81', 444, 1, 22, 767997) If he enters these bodies, he can do so only to divide the majority members, i.e., to take sides with one Muslim party or another.
('81', 444, 1, 23, 768128) If I could make all Hindus Congress minded, I would withdraw every Hindu member from these bodies and put the Muslim members on their honour.
('81', 444, 1, 24, 768270) I would seek to influence them from outside these bodies by being friends with them and rendering disinterested service.
('81', 444, 1, 25, 768391) I would be indifferent to their manning all the services.
('81', 444, 1, 26, 768449) At the most an infinitesimal percentage can
('81', 445, 0, 1, 768493) 446 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 445, 1, 2, 768535) have a share in them.
('81', 445, 1, 3, 768557) And it is a superstition to suppose that these services can oppress a people who have become conscious of human dignity and human rights and know how to enforce them.
('81', 445, 1, 4, 768724) Since the vast majority of Congressmen are Hindus in at least three Muslim majority provinces, they have a rare opportunity of showing their non violent strength, their disinterestedness, their utter freedom from the communal taint, and their ability to submit to the rule of their Muslim fellow countrymen.
('81', 445, 1, 5, 769032) They will do this not in a huff but as true nationalists and friends of the Muslims.
('81', 445, 1, 6, 769117) Remaining outside they will probably better protect the just interests of Hindus as citizens.
('81', 445, 1, 7, 769211) For a Congress Hindu is not any the less a Hindu because he claims to represent equally, as he must, all the other faiths in himself.
('81', 445, 1, 8, 769345) For as I have said, so far as the State is concerned, its capacity for service stops short of the service of the different faiths, and the services it can render apply to all irrespective of their faiths.
('81', 445, 1, 9, 769550) Therefore Congressmen have a rare opportunity of showing undefiled nationalism in these provinces.
('81', 445, 1, 10, 769649) They will incidentally show the other minorities that they have nothing to fear from the majorities if they know the true way.
('81', 445, 1, 11, 769776) We must get out of the miasma of religious majorities and minorities.
('81', 445, 1, 12, 769846) Why is a Parsi’s interest different from a Hindu’s or Muslim’s so far as the State is concerned?
('81', 445, 1, 13, 769943) Did not Dadabhai and Pherozeshah rule the Congress while they lived, not by Congress grace or patronage, but by right of service and merit?
('81', 445, 1, 14, 770083) Did their rule injure any Hindu or Muslim interest?

('81', 445, 1, 16, 770199) And is not the Congress a voluntary State?

('81', 445, 3, 19, 770317) CONGRESS AND A. R. P.
('81', 445, 4, 20, 770339) Q. Can a Congressman belong to A.R.P. and such other committees connected with the war?
('81', 445, 5, 21, 770427) A. I think not.

('81', 445, 6, 24, 770637) ECONOMIC EQUALITY
('81', 445, 7, 25, 770655) Q. While working the constructive programme, can a Congressman preach economic equality?
('81', 445, 7, 26, 770744) How can working the civil disobedience programme bring it about?
('81', 446, 0, 1, 770809) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARY, 1942 447
('81', 446, 1, 2, 770856) A. You can certainly preach it, if your speech is strictly non violent and not in the manner of some who, I know, have preached forcible dispossession of landowners and capitalists.
('81', 446, 1, 3, 771038) But I have shown a better way than preaching.
('81', 446, 1, 4, 771084) The constructive programme takes the country a long way towards the goal.
('81', 446, 1, 5, 771158) This is the most auspicious time for it.
('81', 446, 1, 6, 771199) The charkha and the allied industries, if fully successful, practically abolish all inequalities, both social and economic.
('81', 446, 1, 7, 771323) The rising consciousness of the strength which non violence gives to the people, and their intelligent refusal to co operate in their slavery must bring about equality.
('81', 446, 2, 8, 771492) STRENGTHEN THE ORGANIZATION
('81', 446, 3, 9, 771520) Q. What is the meaning of strengthening the Congress organization?
('81', 446, 4, 10, 771587) A. You can strengthen it no doubt by enlisting members who know the meaning of the fundamental article of the Congress, namely, attainment of Purna Swaraj by peaceful and legitimate means.
('81', 446, 4, 11, 771776) Enlisting of bogus members and members for seizing power in the Congress is vicious and harmful.

('81', 446, 4, 13, 772027) Therefore real strengthening of the organization consists in every Congressman working the constructive programme to its fullest capacity.
('81', 446, 4, 14, 772166) Enlisting bona fide members without much effort provides running expense of the Congress, only if the enlisting itself does not eat up the subscriptions you collect from members.
('81', 446, 4, 15, 772345) ‘OTHER ORGANIZATIONS’

('81', 446, 5, 17, 772463) Do you include communal organizations?
('81', 446, 6, 18, 772502) A. I do.

('81', 447, 3, 4, 773019) REVERED MALAVIYAJI, SIR RADHAKRISHNAN, BROTHERS AND SISTERS, You all know very well that I have neither the physical strength nor the inclination to undertake a long journey, and yet when I received Sir Radhakrishnan’s invitation to deliver an address on the occasion of the Silver Jubilee Convocation of the Benares Hindu University I had not the heart to decline it.
('81', 447, 3, 5, 773388) You know the strong bond of affection that binds me to Malaviyaji, and it is with a certain amount of pride and satisfaction that I obey his behest whenever it is at all possible for me.
('81', 447, 3, 6, 773575) I therefore could not say ‘no’, Sir Radhakrishnan’s letter was a call to a pilgrimage.
('81', 447, 3, 7, 773662) Great as are Malaviyaji’s services to the country, I have no doubt that this University constitutes his greatest service and achievement, and he has worn himself out for the work that is dear to him as life itself.
('81', 447, 3, 8, 773877) It was out of my great regard for him that twenty five years ago I accepted his invitation to attend the foundation ceremony of this University.
('81', 447, 3, 9, 774022) 2 I knew that in that august function, which was to be attended by the Viceroy and the ruling Princes of India, there was no place for a poor man like me.
('81', 447, 3, 10, 774177) I had not then been made a Mahatma, and if anyone called me by that name, I knew I must have been mistaken for Mahatma Munshiramji, as the late Swami Shraddhanand was then called.
('81', 447, 3, 11, 774357) For there cannot be a number of Mahatmas, and I knew even when I was in South Africa that Munshiramji’s great work had entitled him to that name.

('81', 447, 3, 16, 774794) People have great admiration for Malaviyaji Maharaj as you must have heard today.

('81', 452, 3, 18, 788059) 718. DISCUSSION WITH CONGRESS WORKERS 1
('81', 452, 4, 19, 788099) BENARES, January 22, 1942
('81', 452, 5, 20, 788125) Q. What is your ultimate object?
('81', 452, 5, 21, 788158) Do you want the Congress to accept your principles or to achieve its object?
('81', 452, 6, 22, 788235) A. Every plan and programme that I have placed before the Congress has been placed with a view to achieving the goal of independence.

('81', 460, 1, 11, 809117) The remedy is, therefore, to magnify one’s shortcomings.

('81', 460, 1, 16, 809754) The latter is quite natural in that we have descended from the state of brutes, and some of their qualities may have been exaggerated in us.

('81', 463, 1, 2, 815697) 722. A DEPLORABLE INCIDENT 1
('81', 463, 2, 3, 815726) As Sardar Vallabhbhai was leaving Sevagram the other day he told me of a dacoity in a home 2 in Kheda District.
('81', 463, 2, 4, 815838) Armed dacoits entered the house, belaboured the inmates, and escaped with the loot.
('81', 463, 2, 5, 815922) The story was heart rending.
('81', 463, 2, 6, 815951) What should I do under similar circumstances, I thought to myself.
('81', 463, 2, 7, 816018) What should Congressmen do in the circumstances was the next thought; and since then the train of thought arising from the dacoity has taken possession of me.
('81', 463, 2, 8, 816177) The Congress has been working continuously since 1920 under the policy of non violence.
('81', 463, 2, 9, 816265) The province of Gujarat has also had the advantage of a leader of the Sardar’s calibre.
('81', 463, 2, 10, 816353) And yet daring dacoities can take place.
('81', 463, 2, 11, 816394) How far then can Congress influence be said to have penetrated?
('81', 463, 2, 12, 816458) People imagine that, if the British Government were to cease to function today, it would be the non violent Congressmen who would automatically take over.
('81', 463, 2, 13, 816613) But it is not so.
('81', 463, 2, 14, 816631) I have been working to this end for the last twenty years, but my dream has not materialized.
('81', 463, 2, 15, 816725) For the Congress has not had a living faith in the very means which it adopted in 1920. Therefore the non violence of the Congress has really been non violence of the weak.
('81', 463, 2, 16, 816898) But governments can only be run by the strong.
('81', 463, 2, 17, 816945) And a non violent government can only be run by those who believe that non violence is the mightiest force on earth.
('81', 463, 2, 18, 817062) If we had had this strength, there would be no HinduMuslim riots, there would be no robbers or dacoits.
('81', 463, 2, 19, 817166) Some might say that for such strength you need either a Jesus or a Buddha.
('81', 463, 2, 20, 817241) But this is not so.
('81', 463, 2, 21, 817261) Neither Jesus nor Buddha tried non violence in the political sphere, or it would be truer to say that the present day type of politics did not exist in their day.
('81', 463, 2, 22, 817424) The Congress experiment is, therefore, a new one.
('81', 463, 2, 23, 817474) The tragedy is that Congressmen have not tried it with full faith, full understanding and sincerity.
('81', 463, 2, 24, 817575) If they had had these three essential qualities, the Congress would today have been far taller than it is.
('81', 463, 2, 25, 817682) But I may not cry over spilt milk.
('81', 463, 2, 26, 817717) I refer to the past only in order to guide us in the present.
('81', 463, 2, 27, 817779) Even if we wake up now, the game is ours; if we do not, we shall surely lose.
('81', 463, 2, 28, 817857) Power invariably elects to go into the hands of the strong.
('81', 463, 2, 29, 817917) That strength may be physical or of the heart, or, if we do not fight shy of the word, of the spirit.
('81', 463, 2, 30, 818019) Strength of the heart connotes soul force.
('81', 463, 2, 31, 818062) If today we decide that we should try to get power by force of arms, we shall have to undo all the work of twenty years among the masses.
('81', 463, 2, 32, 818200) We shall have to spend a considerable time in giving people a contrary training.
('81', 463, 2, 33, 818281) We cannot afford to give the required time at this
('81', 463, 3, 34, 818332) 1 The Gujarati original of this appeared in Harijanbandhu, 1 2 1942.
('81', 463, 4, 35, 818401) 2 The house of one Jesangbhai

('81', 464, 1, 2, 818478) critical juncture.
('81', 464, 1, 3, 818497) It is certain that today whoever has any strength of any kind will use it for seizing power.
('81', 464, 1, 4, 818590) It is my firm conviction that, if Congressmen are to get power, it should only be through non violence or soul force.
('81', 464, 1, 5, 818708) We have neither time nor material to do new work even in this line.

('81', 464, 1, 8, 819028) There is no risk involved in it.
('81', 464, 1, 9, 819061) Even failure in it takes the form of success because, even if the people are not able to go the whole length in the experiment, they cannot possibly be led into a ditch.
('81', 464, 1, 10, 819231) By following the way of physical force they may not only be proved cowards, but in attempting to follow an untrodden path thousands may also be destroyed.

('81', 464, 1, 13, 819502) Such workers cannot be had for the asking; but Congressmen should know that this work is just as important as it is fraught with risk, and a certain number of them have to devote themselves to it.
('81', 464, 1, 14, 819699) The second thing requisite is that we should prepare such workers as would, under difficult circumstances, stand up to dacoits and, whilst trying to check or convert them from their evil ways, be prepared to suffer hurt or even death.

('81', 469, 7, 9, 826620) 730. “CONSTRUCTIVE PROGRAMME”
('81', 469, 8, 10, 826650) While I was writing the pamphlet 1 on the thirteenfold, now fourteenfold, constructive programme, Rajendra Babu was doing likewise in his own way.
('81', 469, 8, 11, 826797) His pamphlet 2 has now been published by the Navajivan Press, Ahmedabad, at 4 annas (postage 1 anna extra).
('81', 469, 8, 12, 826905) It may be called a companion to mine.

('81', 470, 1, 2, 827302) 731. QUESTION BOX
('81', 470, 2, 3, 827320) UNITARY METHOD
('81', 470, 3, 4, 827335) Q. You seem to be advocating what you call the unitary method in the
('81', 470, 4, 5, 827404) solution of many questions.
('81', 470, 4, 6, 827432) Will you explain it a little more fully than you have
('81', 470, 6, 7, 827486) A. It is as simple as it is sure.
('81', 470, 6, 8, 827520) A contract or pact is between two parties.
('81', 470, 6, 9, 827563) There is also consideration passing from one to the other.
('81', 470, 6, 10, 827622) Such was the Lucknow Pact between the Congress and the Muslim League.
('81', 470, 6, 11, 827692) The same thing could have been accomplished by the unitary method.
('81', 470, 6, 12, 827759) Only then there would have been no compromise dictated by fear and distrust.
('81', 470, 6, 13, 827836) The Congress could have done, according to its notion, absolute justice, i.e., yielded the maximum consistent with the welfare of the whole nation without the expectation of any conside ration from the League.
('81', 470, 6, 14, 828046) In a well regulated family the relations are governed by the unitary method.
('81', 470, 6, 15, 828123) Thus a father gives to his children not as a result of a pact.
('81', 470, 6, 16, 828186) He gives out of love, a sense of justice without expecting any return therefor.
('81', 470, 6, 17, 828266) Not that there is none.
('81', 470, 6, 18, 828290) But everything is natural, nothing is forced.
('81', 470, 6, 19, 828336) Nothing is done out of fear or distrust.
('81', 470, 6, 20, 828377) What is true of a well regulated family is equally true of a well regulated society which is but an extended family.
('81', 470, 6, 21, 828494) My advice about the adoption of two scripts by Hindus and Muslims is based on the unitary method.
('81', 470, 6, 22, 828592) My equal love for all communities dictates its adop tion.
('81', 470, 6, 23, 828650) Properly applied, the method never fails.
('81', 470, 6, 24, 828692) It disarms criticism and opposition.
('81', 470, 6, 25, 828729) It presupposes a clean conscience and clean action.
('81', 470, 6, 26, 828781) I pro pose to unfold in these columns the application of the method in all our communal relations.
('81', 470, 6, 27, 828880) The views will be personal to me, as are all such since the Bardoli Resolution.
('81', 470, 6, 28, 828960) They will be addressed to Con gressmen for adoption only in so far as they appeal to their reason.
('81', 470, 8, 29, 829059) Q. What has come over Rajaji?
('81', 470, 8, 30, 829089) You and he seem to be drifting away from each other.
('81', 470, 9, 31, 829142) A. Yes, we seem to be and yet we are not.
('81', 470, 9, 32, 829184) The seeming drift is but a prelude to a closer bond and clearer understanding.
('81', 470, 9, 33, 829263) His loyalty is above suspicion.
('81', 470, 9, 34, 829295) He would have gladly suppressed himself, if I had not strongly encouraged him to propound his views with a view to their adoption by the public.
('81', 470, 9, 35, 829440) We owe allegiance to the same goddess.
('81', 470, 9, 36, 829479) Our interpretations differ.
('81', 470, 9, 37, 829507) If he is erring, he will retrace his steps as soon as he discovers it.
('81', 470, 9, 38, 829578) And he knows that I would do likewise, if I
('81', 471, 0, 1, 829622) 472 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 471, 1, 2, 829664) discover mine.
('81', 471, 1, 3, 829679) I feel, therefore, absolutely safe with him, and I ask all questioners to do likewise.
('81', 471, 2, 4, 829766) UNTRUTH
('81', 471, 3, 5, 829774) Q. Do you know that you are reported to have said at Benares that it is sinful for any Indian ever to study or speak in English and you are charged with insincerity in that you make such liberal use of the hated language when it suits you?
('81', 471, 4, 6, 830014) A. The report is wholly untrue.
('81', 471, 4, 7, 830046) But once an untruth gets a start it is most difficult to overtake.
('81', 471, 4, 8, 830113) Many untruths about me have had such a start.
('81', 471, 4, 9, 830159) They created a temporary sensation and got a decent burial without any effort on my part.
('81', 471, 4, 10, 830249) So will this one.
('81', 471, 4, 11, 830267) No untruth has ever done any harm to anyone if there was no bottom to it.
('81', 471, 4, 12, 830341) I am answering the question, not to protect my reputation but to carry my point further.
('81', 471, 4, 13, 830430) The charge of insincerity is itself the best refutation of the untruth.
('81', 471, 4, 14, 830502) For my free use of the English language is not a thing of today.
('81', 471, 4, 15, 830567) The charge should have been regarded as unworthy of belief.
('81', 471, 4, 16, 830627) Let it be known that I am a lover of the English language and the English.
('81', 471, 4, 17, 830702) But my love is wise and intelligent.
('81', 471, 4, 18, 830739) Therefore I give both the place they deserve.
('81', 471, 4, 19, 830785) Thus I do not allow the English language to dis place the mother tongue or the natural all India language—Hindus tani.
('81', 471, 4, 20, 830904) Nor do I let my love of the English displace my fellow country men whose interest I can in no way allow to be injured.
('81', 471, 4, 21, 831023) I recognize the great importance of the English language for international intercourse.
('81', 471, 4, 22, 831111) I hold its knowledge as a second language to be indispen sable for specified Indians who have to represent the country’s interest in the international domain.
('81', 471, 4, 23, 831270) I regard the English language as an open window for peeping into Western thought and sciences.
('81', 471, 4, 24, 831365) For this too I should set apart a class.
('81', 471, 4, 25, 831406) Through them I would spread through the Indian languages the knowledge they have gained from the West.
('81', 471, 4, 26, 831509) But I would not burden India’s children and sap their youthful energy by expecting the expansion of their brains through the medium of a foreign language.
('81', 471, 4, 27, 831664) I do hold it to be a sin on the part of those who are responsible for producing the unnatural condition under which we are being educated.
('81', 471, 4, 28, 831803) Such a thing is unknown in any other part of the world.
('81', 471, 4, 29, 831859) Being too near the scene of the wreck we are unaware of the damage the nation has suffered by it.
('81', 471, 4, 30, 831957) I can see the enormity of the damage because of my daily and close contact with the dumb and suppressed millions.
('81', 471, 5, 31, 832071) ANOTHER UNTRUTH
('81', 471, 6, 32, 832087) Q. You are reported by the Press to have approvingly referred to the progress made by the Japanese in adopting Western methods with a thoroughness hitherto unknown in the East.
('81', 471, 6, 33, 832264) Is not this a contradiction of all you have written about the West?
('81', 471, 6, 34, 832332) Or is there one law for India and another for Japan?
('81', 472, 0, 1, 832385) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARY, 1942 473
('81', 472, 1, 2, 832432) A. This is another untruth like the one about the English language.
('81', 472, 1, 3, 832500) The reader will find out for himself from Mahadev Desai’s report of my Benares speech 1 as to what I actually said about the Japanese.
('81', 472, 1, 4, 832635) The burden of my speech was the undesirability of making English the medium of instruction and all India speech.
('81', 472, 1, 5, 832748) I said in this connection that, however harmful in my opinion the Japanese adaptation of the West was, the rapid progress was due to the restric tion of the learning of the Western mode to a select few and using them for transmission of the new knowledge among the Japanese through their own mother tongue.
('81', 472, 1, 6, 833055) Surely it is easy enough to under stand that the Japanese could never have adapted themselves to the new mode, if they had had to do so through a foreign medium.

('81', 473, 1, 2, 834287) 733. TALK TO KHADI VIDYALAYA STUDENTS 1
('81', 473, 2, 3, 834327) SEVAGRAM, January 29, 1942 I have something to say about the manner in which you just came and sat here.
('81', 473, 2, 4, 834432) 2 The task before us is so great and pure that it should influence our manner of speech as well as movement, in fact all our actions as well as thoughts.
('81', 473, 2, 5, 834586) When we assemble to hear someone we should sit in a decent posture, without being huddled together.
('81', 473, 2, 6, 834686) And we should make it a point to sit up straight and erect and in an attentive posture.
('81', 473, 2, 7, 834774) The way you are huddled together, one upon another, shows a lack of manners, of culture.
('81', 473, 2, 8, 834863) Every tradition has its own definite style of deportment.
('81', 473, 2, 9, 834921) In Western countries, people sit on chairs in a prescribed manner.
('81', 473, 2, 10, 834988) The military training they receive also influences their style.
('81', 473, 2, 11, 835052) We also have our own concept of good manners.
('81', 473, 2, 12, 835098) But we have forgotten it.
('81', 473, 2, 13, 835124) We have learnt nothing new from the West.
('81', 473, 2, 14, 835166) That is why our plight is like Trishanku’s 3, neither here nor there.
('81', 473, 2, 15, 835236) We have our own code of postures, which helps make physical as well as spiritual progress.
('81', 473, 2, 16, 835327) It is something we can offer the world provided we assimilate it in our lives.
('81', 473, 2, 17, 835406) But we have now grown indo lent.
('81', 473, 2, 18, 835439) This is about the ancient Hindu tradition.
('81', 473, 2, 19, 835482) The Arabs too have their own code of etiquette.
('81', 473, 2, 20, 835530) They also have a graceful manner of sitting and rising.
('81', 473, 2, 21, 835586) Their prayers too are offered in their own prescribed style.
('81', 473, 2, 22, 835647) In short, the only purpose of my saying all this is that whatever we do should have a method about it—a code to govern it.
('81', 473, 2, 23, 835770) If you fulfil the expectations entertained about you, you can surpass the students of Government schools or colleges.
('81', 473, 2, 24, 835888) In my view the importance of this Vidyalaya is not less but in fact more than that of a school or college.
('81', 473, 2, 25, 835995) You are judged also by the way you lie and sit, by the manner and matter of your talk.
('81', 473, 2, 26, 836082) Every action of a man from the cradle to the grave should be steeped in his culture.
('81', 473, 2, 27, 836167) I would like to see your own culture in every one of your actions.
('81', 473, 2, 28, 836234) It is not enough for you merely to learn spinning and weaving; it is only a means.
('81', 473, 2, 29, 836317) Two things are most essential for man to subsist.
('81', 473, 2, 30, 836367) One is food and the other clothing.
('81', 473, 2, 31, 836403) There are three ways of solving the problem of food and clothing.
('81', 473, 2, 32, 836469) One of them is to get them in the form of charity.
('81', 473, 2, 33, 836520) But it is not proper.
('81', 473, 2, 34, 836542) It does not mitigate the poverty of the people.
('81', 473, 3, 35, 836590) 1 After the evening prayer Gandhiji addressed the students from different provinces who had one month’s training at the Vidyalaya.
('81', 473, 3, 36, 836721) 2 There was some confusion when the students took their seats at the meeting.
('81', 473, 3, 37, 836799) 3 Who hung between heaven and earth
('81', 474, 0, 1, 836835) VOL. 81 : 18 AUGUST, 1941 8 FEBRUARY, 1942 475
('81', 474, 1, 2, 836882) the contrary, it makes beggars of them.
('81', 474, 1, 3, 836922) The other way is to take up employment and earn wages with which to subsist.
('81', 474, 1, 4, 836999) This too makes us dependent.
('81', 474, 1, 5, 837028) The third way is to arrange the production of food and clothing.
('81', 474, 1, 6, 837093) This can be done in two ways.
('81', 474, 1, 7, 837123) Either through spinning wheels or through mechanized factories.
('81', 474, 1, 8, 837187) By mass producing the goods we can certainly become self dependent collectively, but not individually.
('81', 474, 1, 9, 837290) In case of air raids where will they drop the bombs if not on the workshops and factories?
('81', 474, 1, 10, 837381) Certainly not on the [small] dwelling units where taklis and spinning wheels are plying.
('81', 474, 1, 11, 837470) If eventually we are left with no other means of producing cloth, we shall be obliged to depend on others for our needs.
('81', 474, 1, 12, 837591) And if the factories are diverted to the manufacture of ammunitions, there will be no other means but the spinning wheel left with us.
('81', 474, 1, 13, 837726) All this can happen in future.
('81', 474, 1, 14, 837757) If we can foresee it we should provide for it right from today.
('81', 474, 1, 15, 837821) Today we need khadi worth one billion rupees, out of which we shall be able to produce at the most khadi worth one crore.
('81', 474, 1, 16, 837943) It is no great achievement in my view.
('81', 474, 1, 17, 837982) You are being trained here so that when you leave you may teach the people to produce their own requirements and stand on their own legs.
('81', 474, 1, 18, 838120) Today if someone comes to me even after passing his M.A., I would ask him too what his ultimate aim in life was.
('81', 474, 1, 19, 838233) What does he want to do?
('81', 474, 1, 20, 838258) Employment of some sort, isn’t it?
('81', 474, 1, 21, 838293) To secure employ ment and earn his bread.
('81', 474, 1, 22, 838335) But that is not your aim.
('81', 474, 1, 23, 838361) If you come here to be trained so that you can earn your bread you cannot interest a man like me.
('81', 474, 1, 24, 838459) Here is before you a course covering one year, not several as in the schools and colleges.
('81', 474, 1, 25, 838550) The aim is to devise a scheme by which the whole of India, every single man in the country, can stand on his own feet.
('81', 474, 1, 26, 838669) By producing cloth in the mills the money does not go to the poor but it moves from the poor man’s pocket into the rich man’s.
('81', 474, 1, 27, 838796) On the other hand, if I buy khadi, I transfer some money to the poor and help them to be self reliant.
('81', 474, 1, 28, 838899) In this way if we succeed in making them self reliant in one matter alone, they will themselves learn to be so in all other matters.
('81', 474, 1, 29, 839032) Khadi is like the carpenter’s set square.
('81', 474, 1, 30, 839074) When with its help he corrects one angle, the remaining angles stand corrected in consequence.
('81', 474, 1, 31, 839169) In the same way, if we could establish khadi, many other things would take root without special effort on our part.
('81', 474, 1, 32, 839285) As a result of the work we have done for khadi, many village industries have now been revived and the activities of the A. I. V. I. A. are gaining ground.
('81', 474, 1, 33, 839440) If you look at khadi work from this angle, you will realize what splendid thing khadi is and consequently your work and its impact too will be equally splendid.
('81', 475, 0, 1, 839601) 476 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('81', 475, 1, 2, 839643) Bear in mind that you are learning the way of filling the poor man’s pocket and not your family’s.

('81', 478, 2, 3, 845720) I have been asked which way my sympathy lies.

('81', 478, 2, 5, 845845) I do not wish that the British should be defeated, nor do I wish the defeat of the Germans.

('81', 478, 2, 7, 846114) Will not bitterness in any one nation constitute seeds of a future war?
('81', 478, 2, 8, 846186) Whatever it is, if the present war continues till the bitter end, civilization itself will be reduced to ashes in this conflagration.
('81', 478, 2, 9, 846320) Let us pray that it will stop before it is too late.
('81', 478, 2, 10, 846373) Still, can it stop so long as there is hatred in the hearts of men?
('81', 478, 2, 11, 846441) If I have hatred for even one individual, will it not imperceptibly spread to all his countrymen?
('81', 478, 2, 12, 846539) Of course, there is ample reason for condemning the German dictator.

('81', 483, 3, 5, 858334) 740. THREE ESSENTIALS
('81', 483, 4, 6, 858356) Assuming the presence of the will among the millions, rapid spread of hand spinning is possible only by the adoption of the following three things : 1. Use of unginned cotton from the nearest spot when it is not grown on one’s own plot.
('81', 483, 4, 7, 858593) 2. Ginning it on a polished board with an iron or smooth wooden rod and carding the cotton by manipulation of the cotton with fingers assisted by a wooden knife made on the spot.
('81', 483, 4, 8, 858772) This process is called tunai ( ).
('81', 483, 4, 9, 858806) 3. Spinning the slivers on the dhanush takli.
('81', 483, 4, 10, 858852) Hand gins cannot be manufactured to order today.
('81', 483, 4, 11, 858901) All available unginned cotton should be prepared first by the method explained in 2 above.
('81', 483, 4, 12, 858992) Where unginned cotton is not available ginned cotton from factories has got to be used.
('81', 483, 4, 13, 859080) It too lends itself to tunai, though much more time is required for carding by the tunai process when bale cotton has to be used.
('81', 483, 4, 14, 859210) Where a carding bow is available, naturally it will be used.
('81', 483, 4, 15, 859271) But what is true of ginning is equally true of carding.
('81', 483, 4, 16, 859327) It is not possible to manufacture bows and gut in a moment.
('81', 483, 4, 17, 859387) Tunai is a method devised and being perfected by Shri Vinoba with an artist’s skill and ardour.
('81', 483, 4, 18, 859483) When spinning spreads among the millions it will be impossible to supply slivers from a centre or centres.
('81', 483, 4, 19, 859590) The utmost that is possible is for families or groups to set apart one or two hands per a fixed number for carding.
('81', 483, 4, 20, 859706) The ideal, the best, and in the long run the quickest, way is for each one to prepare his own slivers.
('81', 483, 4, 21, 859809) It makes spinning more interesting, and the variety of occupation breaks the monotony.
('81', 483, 4, 22, 859896) I suggest that, though the crisis is not yet felt and the mills are working, khadi workers will do well from now to adopt the suggestions I have made.
('81', 483, 4, 23, 860047) When the crisis does come, we shall then be found ready.
('81', 483, 4, 24, 860104) SEVAGRAM, February 2, 1942 Harijan, 22 2 1942

('81', 484, 2, 3, 860228) The following letter 1 was written on the 29th ultimo and sent to me by its writer by registered post.
('81', 484, 2, 4, 860331) It was received at Sevagram on the 31st ultimo : The writer has signed the letter, but as it is marked personal I refrain from giving his name.
('81', 484, 2, 5, 860475) In any case the name does not matter.
('81', 484, 2, 6, 860513) What the writer says is, I know, the belief held by many Muslims.
('81', 484, 2, 7, 860579) My repudiation has not undone the mischief.
('81', 484, 2, 8, 860623) But my article 2 which was written on the 23rd ultimo and has appeared in Harijan of the 1st instant, should soothe the writer so far as I am concerned.
('81', 484, 2, 9, 860776) I entirely agree with my correspondent that all who want one all India speech should today learn both the forms—Hindi and Urdu.
('81', 484, 2, 10, 860904) Those who do will ultimately give us a common language.
('81', 484, 2, 11, 860960) That form which is more popular and more understood by the masses, whether Hindu or Muslim, will surely be the all India speech.
('81', 484, 2, 12, 861089) But if my proposal finds general acceptance, the language question will cease to be a political issue or a bone of contention.
('81', 484, 2, 13, 861216) I do not subscribe to the correspondent’s statement that Urdu is “more developed, more beautiful, more attractive, more concise, and more expressive”.
('81', 484, 2, 14, 861367) No language is intrinsically all that the corres pondent says.
('81', 484, 2, 15, 861430) A language becomes what its speakers and writers make it.
('81', 484, 2, 16, 861488) English had no merit apart from what Englishmen made it.
('81', 484, 2, 17, 861545) In other words, a language is a human creation and takes the colour of its creators.
('81', 484, 2, 18, 861630) Every language is capable of infinite expansion.
('81', 484, 2, 19, 861679) Modern Bengali is what Bankim 3 and Rabindranath have made it.
('81', 484, 2, 20, 861742) If, therefore, it is true that Urdu is more everything than Hindi, it is because its creators are abler than those of Hindi.
('81', 484, 2, 21, 861867) I can give no opinion, for I have not studied either as a linguist.
('81', 484, 2, 22, 861935) I know just enough of both for my public work.
('81', 484, 2, 23, 861982) But is Urdu a language distinct from Hindi as, say, Bengali is from Marathi?
('81', 484, 2, 24, 862059) Is not Urdu a direct descedant of Hindi, written in the Persian character with a tendency to borrow new words from Persian and Arabic rather than Sanskrit?
('81', 484, 2, 25, 862215) If there was no estrangement between the two communities, such a phenomenon would have been

('81', 485, 1, 5, 862908) He seems to think that Hindustani will finally displace all the provincial languages.
('81', 485, 1, 6, 862994) That is neither my dream nor of those who have been thinking of an all India speech.

('81', 485, 1, 8, 863283) The tragedy can be prevented only if the common speech spoken by the largest number of India’s inhabitants is adopted as the interprovincial speech.

('81', 485, 1, 24, 864983) Then the equation would be not Hindustani = Hindi + Urdu, but Hindustani = Hindi = Urdu.

('81', 486, 1, 2, 865164) 742. THE ASHRAM PRAYER 1
('81', 486, 2, 3, 865189) The Ashram prayer has become very popular.
('81', 486, 2, 4, 865232) Its development has been spontaneous.
('81', 486, 2, 5, 865270) The Ashram Bhajanavali 2 (Hymn Book) has gone into several editions and is increasingly in demand.
('81', 486, 2, 6, 865369) The birth and growth of this prayer has not been artificial.
('81', 486, 2, 7, 865430) There is a history attached to almost every shloka and every selected bhajan.
('81', 486, 2, 8, 865508) The Bhajanavali contains among others bhajans from Muslim Sufis and Fakirs, from Guru Nanak, and from the Christian Hymnary.
('81', 486, 2, 9, 865633) Every religion seems to have found a natural setting in the prayer book.
('81', 486, 2, 10, 865706) Chinese, Burmese, Jews, Ceylonese, Muslims, Parsis, Europeans and Americans have all lived in the Ashram from time to time.
('81', 486, 2, 11, 865830) In the same way two Japanese sadhus came to me in Maganwadi in 1935. One of them was with me till the other day when war broke out with Japan.
('81', 486, 2, 12, 865973) He was an ideal inmate of our home in Sevagram.
('81', 486, 2, 13, 866021) He took part in every activity with zest.
('81', 486, 2, 14, 866063) I never heard of his quarrelling with anyone.
('81', 486, 2, 15, 866109) He was a silent worker.
('81', 486, 2, 16, 866133) He learnt as much Hindi as he could.
('81', 486, 2, 17, 866170) He was a strict observer of his vows.
('81', 486, 2, 18, 866208) Every morning and evening he could be seen going round with his drum and heard chanting his mantra.
('81', 486, 2, 19, 866308) The evening worship always commenced with his mantra
('81', 486, 3, 20, 866361) , which means “I bow to the Buddha, the giver of true religion.” I shall never forget the quickness, the orderliness, and utter detachment with which he prepared himself the day the police came without notice to take him away from the Ashram.
('81', 486, 3, 21, 866604) He took leave of me after reciting his favourite mantra and left his drum with me.
('81', 486, 3, 22, 866687) “You are leaving us, but your mantra will remain an integral part of our Ashram prayer,” were the words that came spontaneously to my lips.
('81', 486, 3, 23, 866827) Since then, in spite of his absence, our morning and evening worship has commenced with the mantra.
('81', 486, 3, 24, 866927) For me it is a constant reminder of Sadhu Keshav’s purity and single eyed devotion.
('81', 486, 3, 25, 867011) Indeed its efficacy lies in that sacred memory.
('81', 486, 3, 26, 867059) While Sadhu Keshav was still with us, Bibi Raihana Tyabji also came to stay at Sevagram for a few days.
('81', 486, 3, 27, 867163) I knew her to be a devout Muslim but was not aware, before the death of her illustrious father, of how well versed she was in Koran Sharif.
('81', 486, 3, 28, 867303) When that jewel of Gujarat, Tyabji Saheb, expired no sound of weeping broke the awful silence in his room.
('81', 486, 3, 29, 867410) The latter echoed with Bibi Raihana’s sonorous recitation of verses from the Koran.
('81', 486, 3, 30, 867494) Such as Abbas Tyabji Saheb cannot die.

('81', 488, 4, 10, 870128) AMRIT, An ideal secretary keeps her chief straight where he is going astray.
('81', 488, 4, 11, 870205) She hovers round him and watches all the movement about him, picks up his papers, even torn, lest he might have torn important ones in mistake, collects all she has given him, if it is to be found anywhere.

('81', 488, 4, 16, 870709) Follow the spirit of this note and you will be an ideal secretary.
('81', 488, 4, 17, 870776) This is my birthday present which goes loaded with all the good wishes that I am capable of conceiving.
